gingerbread man abbreviations used although i am british i learnt using american terms so stiches are us stitches also please note i am left handed this has no bearing on the written pattern at all but means photos will appear as a mirror image for all you right handed peeps out there abbreviation explanation mc magic_ring single_crochet single_crochet uk double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain decrease single_crochet two stitches together or decrease sc3tog single_crochet three stitches together or decrease 3 into 1 increase increase two stitches into the same stitch frsc foundation row single_crochet st stitch -------- x- repeat actions in brackets by amount of times stated after x --st at end of round to show stitch count in that round single_crochet in -- place 1 single_crochet into each of the number of sts shown rs right side front of the project ws wrong side back of the project techniques decrease place hook through st yarn over pull through place hook through next stitch yarn over pull through yarn over pull through both loops sc3tog place hook through st yarn over pull through place hook through next st yarn over pull through place hook through next st yarn over pull through yarn over and pull through all loops on hook frsc foundation row single_crochet allows the chains you begin a project with and first row of single_crochet to be done at the same time there are videos 3 www facebook com/elli crochet copyright elli s crochet 2017 christmas gingerbread man on you tube showing how to do this and you may find it beneficial to view these i have included photos and notes providing an alternative at the end of the project to help you for use in this project begin the first frsc by placing your hook through the last st you crocheted into just as if you were going to increase yarn over pull though this is the chain section of your st yarn over pull through one loop yarn over pull through both loops one loop on hook st complete throughout the pattern you will be required to ch1 at the beginning of the row this does not count as a stitch will not be included in the stitch count and means you need to place your 1st single_crochet of the row in the same st as your chain 1 your man will be worked from the head down it will be necessary to fasten_off and reattach your yarn in several places it will also be necessary to leave stitches unworked and return to them at a later point please note each arm and the body are begun with the rs of your work facing you whereas with the 2nd leg it is started with the ws facing you the row count is done as a single count
